meanings.definition: Situated, placed, or occurring at or near the bottom or end of something.
meanings.sent1: The smallest fish in the pond swam at the lowest part of the water.
meanings.sent2: The basement is the lowest level of the house.
meanings.sent3: The lowest step on the ladder was so tiny, it felt like a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her self-esteem hit its lowest point after the criticism.
meanings.sent5: The lowest shelf in the store was almost touching the ground.

meanings.definition: Of the smallest degree or amount.
meanings.sent1: She received the lowest score in the class on the test.
meanings.sent2: The temperature dropped to its lowest point of the season.
meanings.sent3: His voice was so low, it sounded like the lowest whisper.
meanings.sent4: The lowest price for the item was beyond her budget.
meanings.sent5: The lowest number on the scale indicated the lightest weight.

meanings.sent1: The smallest and lowest task was assigned to the new intern.
meanings.sent2: He felt his opinion was often treated as the lowest priority.
meanings.sent3: The lowest joke in the comedy show made everyone laugh unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Being ignored by her friends made her feel like the lowest person in the room.
meanings.sent5: The lowest job in the company involved cleaning the bathrooms.
